alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 5:14PM CDT until May 17 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw and Washington. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Clara, Millry, Buckatunna, Silas, Mehaffey, Shady Grove, Contwell, Denham, Belmont, Aquilla, Dunbar, Healing Springs, Gretna, Winchester, Isney, Chicora, Barlow and Battles.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
